alert.note: Alert for Custer; Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong wind gusts from a line of showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Big Horn, western Custer, northwestern Powder River, Rosebud and eastern Treasure Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 627 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms producing strong wind gusts along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Cohagen to 12 miles southeast of Busby. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Gusts of 40 to 50 mph have been occuring along this line for the past hour. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Local areas of blowing dust will reduce visibility at times. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Big Horn, western Custer, northwestern Powder River, Rosebud and eastern Treasure Counties, including the following locations... Hathaway, Vananda, Brandenberg, Rock Springs, Angela, Muddy Cluster, Moon Creek Ranch, Garland, Cartersville and Birney Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building as storms approach.

area.areaDesc: Custer; Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Treasure
